Constructor Detail

TwiML

public TwiML(TwiML... nested)

The TwiML object represents the top-level container, i.e. the <Response> element in the TwiML. You may supply a comma separated list of any TwiML elements. These include items of type @{Say}, @{Play}, @{Gather}, @{Record}, @{Sms}, @{Dial}, @{Hangup}, @{Redirect}, @{Reject}, and @{Pause}.

Parameters:
nested - Valid nested items are of type @{Say}, @{Play}, @{Gather}, @{Record}, @{Sms}, @{Dial}, @{Hangup}, @{Redirect}, @{Reject}, and @{Pause}.
Method Detail

addVerb

public void addVerb(TwiML item)
Append a TwiML verb into the Response body. This call permits you to build the TwiML response dynamically rather than declaratively.

Parameters:
item - Valid items are @{Say}, @{Play}, @{Gather}, @{Record}, @{Sms}, @{Dial}, @{Hangup}, @{Redirect}, @{Reject}, and @{Pause}.

getNested

public java.util.List<TwiML> getNested()
Returns:
all the TwiML verbs nested in this instance.

toXml

public java.lang.String toXml(java.lang.String baseUrl)
Convert this object into its XML representation of TwiML.

Parameters:
baseUrl - all 'action' parameters will be turned into a relative URL by prepending this baseUrl to the action name.
Returns:
a string representation of the TwiML structure.

toXml

public void toXml(java.lang.StringBuilder buf,
                  java.lang.String baseUrl)
Converts this object into XML. This function is normally called by the state machine servlet and not called directly by you.

Specified by:
toXml in interface ToXML
